ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: The course provides a good overview of tools used to manage resources. Doing the independent project was the most valuable because it allows you to think through the process and applicability even more.
The professor was very interesting but the course material was a bit disorganized.
Chad's anecdotes and wisdom from experience.
The independent project and the exercise about planning.
integrated projects that inspire group cooperation
Chad Oliver.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: A well-defined course structure.
I wish more time would have been given to students to develop models based on what we saw. Also perhaps do more case studies.
more readings
More structure.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: They were both very friendly and available.
excellent
The instructor was very helpful and often offered to work with us outside of class.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: very pertinent. it is important to know how the implementation component works

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I took it because it was recommended to me, and fit my study plans.
wanted to learn tools.
I thought it would be a good practical overview of resource management.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes.
Yes and No. initially it started a bit slow but then it picked up.
yes!
Somewhat; by the end it was focused on forest management, while I had been hoping for more general resource management.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes.
Yes. But i wish we could have focussed some of the large concepts with case studies.
yes!
Somewhat (see note above).

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: There were only 5 of us, so it was great to work together and get to know everyone better.
We had different skills sets which were important for complementing each other;s work.
seeing the whole from the parts and how the parts create the wholedelegating responsibility
Excellent; the instructor flexibility in allowing us to work in groups was great.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: You'll get out as much as you put in.
Be patient in the first month. And do give yourself enough time to do the problem sets.
Work in groups!
